text.title: Maintain Mental Health with Exercise
text.head: Maintain Mental Health with Exercise
text.p: There is a lot of proof that exercise will benefit your mental health and creativity. But what are the best exercises for maintaining a healthy mind and body? Here are some tips but know that the most important thing is to stay consistent, listen to your body and know what's best for you.
text.head: Steps
Casual exercises

list.item:
Go for a walk routinely.This is the easiest way of exersising, which will not only keep your body moving but also relaxes your mind
Spare around 10-60minutes each day to just wander around the block or a park nearby
Listen to some music or podcasts
Try walking meditation

Jogging. Light running can free your mind and achieving certain distances can boost your serotonin level, which will keep up your overall happiness
Plan around 10-60minutes each day to jog around the block or in a nearby park
Listen to motivational music or try guided runs via apps
Begin small by starting to run 10minutes and increase it slowly
Don't push yourself to run a certain distance in a certain time

Cycling. Just like the previous exercises this one not only improves your stamina but also reliefs your mind from tension.
Get yourself a bike. It does'nt have to be an overly expensive one
Plan to cycle to work, school or anywhere else
Start slow and organize more time for your ride than the GPS estimates. This will reduce stress.
Be safe. Wear a helmet and look out for car drivers, traffic lights and signs.

text.head: Gym exersises

list.item:
Extended light cardio.
Go on a treadmill, stationary bike or stairmaster
Plan around 30minutes for your workout
Take it easy by setting a low speed or resistance
Listen to music or podcasts but don't watch a series or a movie as this will occupy your mind.

Follow a training plan or routine.
Ask a trainer to help you with a plan perfected for your desired results. This will help you with motivation to go to the gym.
Use your phone only to listen to music. Don't scroll through social media while resting in between laps.
Focus on the exercise, not the surrounding and the people. This way your mind does't wander and you get trough your exercises more quickly.

text.head: Ultimate mental health exercises

list.item:
Yoga. As stereotypical as it seems yoga is the best way to ground yourself, improve your flexibility and boost your mental health. With elements similar to meditation it offers deep relaxation while exercising.
Try out a yoga class at your gym. Most gym memberships include classes such as yoga class. Look at the schedule and visit one. You won't find scrawny models or grandmas but rather the regular people you see at the gym.
Try guided yoga routines at home.

Tai chi. Just like yoga it helps you stay connective to your body, control your movement and relax your mind.
Consider tai chi classes
Try out a free first lesson to see if it fits you

text.head: Tips

list.item: Don't push your limits and overpower your body while exercising. Be sure to rest appropriately and don't be so hard on yourself if you only lift light weights or run slowly. Your mental health is more important than what others think of you
